definitions.definition: To send or officially charge someone or some group to do something.
examples: James Bond was commissioned with recovering the secret documents.

definitions.definition: To place an order for (often a piece of art ).
examples: He commissioned a replica of the Mona Lisa for his living room, but the painter gave up after six months.

definitions.definition: To put (a ship or boat , etc.) into active service .
examples: The aircraft carrier was commissioned in 1944, during WWII.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To send or officially charge someone or some group to do something.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To place an order for (often a piece of art ).
( transitive ) To put (a ship or boat , etc.) into active service .
